items.title: Rina Sawayama Sends â€˜Big Loveâ€™ to Sabrina Carpenter, But Calls Out Cultural Insensitivity in â€˜SNLâ€™ Performance
items.summary: She also asked creative teams to employ more "research, respect and care" when referencing cultures.
items.body: Rina Sawayama has nothing against Sabrina Carpenter , but parts of the latter’s Saturday Night Live performance of “Nobody’s Son” over the weekend didn’t sit right with the former. Related Sabrina Carpenter Drops F-Bomb, Dances in Underwear While Performing ‘Manchild’ & ‘Nobodyâ€™s Son’ on ‘SNL’: Watch Domingo Returns to ‘SNL’ as Sabrina Carpenter Parodies Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’: Watch Sabrina Carpenter’s Debut as ‘SNL’ Host: All 8 Sketches Ranked On Instagram Stories on Sunday (Oct. 19), the Japanese-British singer-songwriter shared a clip of Carpenter’s showcase, which had a martial arts theme. As the hitmaker sang while wearing a short white robe and black belt as a dress, background dancers acted out a fight sequence behind her. Zooming in on the footwear of the background performers, Sawayama wrote, “Big love to Sabrina but fellow artists creative teams … if we are clearly referencing a culture, please can you do so with the research, respect and care it deserves.” “Shoes on tatami is jail,” she added. â€¦

items.title: Cardi B Gets â€˜Pretty & Pettyâ€™ by Dropping a Video for Her BIA DissÂ Track
items.summary: "Pretty & Pettyâ€¦ and pregnant," she wrote.
items.body: Cardi B is leaning into the three P’s of life for herself right now: pretty, petty and pregnant. The Bronx rapper returned to release a DIY visual to her Am I the Drama? track “Pretty & Petty” on Sunday (Oct. 19). Related Cardi B Says Dropping Video For BIA Diss Track ‘Would Be Bullying’: ‘Iâ€™mma Be Nice to You Because Itâ€™s Your Album Day’ Sen. Martin Heinrich Backs Cardi B’s Claims About the Economy & Cost of Living Being Too High: She ‘Is Right’ Cardi B Calls Out Trump Administration For Cuts to Food Assistance Programs: ‘I Don’t Know How People Are Surviving’ Cardi appeared to shoot the clip either at home or an office of sorts, and in the visual, she is draped in a polka-dot dress, hugging her curves and pregnant belly. The DJ Swanqo-produced track, which reached No. 43 on the Billboard Hot 100 , turned heads for Cardi’s bristling bars directed at dissing BIA. “Name five BIA songs, gun pointin’ to your head/ Baow, I’m dead,” she raps, before dropping to the floor in the clip. Later in the track, Cardi continues to diss BIA while taking shots at her looksâ€¦

items.title: Lenny TavÃ¡rez & More Share Key Advice for Indie Artists at Latin Music WeekÂ 2025
items.summary: Lenny TavÃ¡rez and more artists join the Power of Independence" panel at the 2025 Billboard Latin Music Week.
items.body: The 2025 Billboard Latin Music Week officially kicked off Monday (Oct. 20) at The Fillmore Miami Beach with “The Power of Independence” panel presented by Platoon. In the conversation â€” moderated by Billboard’s Ingrid Fajardo â€” artist Lenny TavÃ¡rez, duo producer MadMusick (comprised of brothers Yan and Yon) and Pinky Mordan (head of Latin music at Platoon), discussed how to successfully lead a career as an independent artist. Below, check out the best takeaways from the panel: Pinky on Discovering New Artists: “Managing [artists] as an independent boutique is interesting. At Platoon, we specifically seek out artists we want to work with and make an impact on the genre.” Lenny on Major Label vs. Indie Label: “All my processes have been necessary. I miss some things about [major] record labels, but they’re not as powerful. I think the positive thing about being independent is that they don’t try to change the DNA you want to project yourself with. When I started with Sony as my duo Dyland and Lenny, the A&R told us we needed a merengue. The label came with pre-made songs. Later, when I moved to Warner, they had many of the characteâ€¦

items.title: Ouraâ€™s got new tools to help you manage long-term stress
items.summary: Cumulative Stress tracking and a Blood Pressure Profile study are coming soon.
items.body: TL;DR In the next few weeks, the Oura app is getting a major update with new stress management and period tracking functionality. Oura is also kicking off a trial to estimate usersâ€™ risk of high blood pressure in the coming months. The blood pressure trial will be open to Oura Labs participants. Smart ring maker Oura introduced stress tracking to its platform in 2023. Today, the company announced that itâ€™s building on these shorter-term stress features with an upcoming tool thatâ€™s meant to give you insight into how your body is handling stress over time. Ouraâ€™s also taking the first steps to develop features thatâ€™ll warn users when their blood pressure may be creeping up. In a press release , Oura detailed a busy end to the year. Over the next few weeks, Oura will be rolling out a new Cumulative Stress feature, improvements to its Cycle Insights, and a major update to its app. Itâ€™s also kicking off a study to develop a feature itâ€™s calling Blood Pressure Profile, which combine trends measured by Oura Ring wearables with questionnaire responses to give users a rough idea of whether their blood pressure may be cause for concern.

items.title: No Doubt Is Playing Las Vegasâ€™ Sphere: Hereâ€™s How to ScoreÂ Tickets
items.summary: The band went on hiatus in the mid-2010s.
items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. You read that right. After almost a decade apart, No Doubt is back. The band is set to play 12 shows that will run in May at the Sphere in Las Vegas, visible from the glitzy Las Vegas Strip . First reported by TMZ , this stint will make singer Gwen Stefani the first woman to headline the 17,600-seat arena. Since opening in late 2023, the arena has hosted the likes of U2, Dead & Company, Eagles, Backstreet Boys and more. The news of the band’s reunion at the Sphere was posted to the venue’s Instagram on Oct. 10 along with the caption, “Remain seated, please. Permanecer sentados, por favor. Welcome to the Vegas skyline. ğŸŠğŸ‘‘ We are pleased to announce our limited engagement run, No Doubt Live @SphereVegas , May 2026.” View this post on Instagram A post shared by No Doubt (@nodoubt) If you’re pumped for the band’s reunion, you can shop tickets for their upcoming shows at the Sphere below. items.title: Rush Expand 50th Anniversary Tour Again, Add 17 Cities to 2026 North American ArenaÂ Swing
items.summary: Geddy Lee and guitarist Alex Lifeson will be joined by German drummer Anika Nilles on the outing that is slated to kick off on June 7 in Los Angeles.
items.body: After announcing an initial run of 12 shows celebrating their 50th anniversary as a band and then expanding on that first run of gigs, Rush has added another 17 dates to their Fifty Something 2026 arena tour . On Monday morning (Oct. 20), founding members bassist/singer Geddy Lee and guitarist/singer Alex Lifeson announced that they have added new shows in Philadelphia, Boston, Montreal, Washington, D.C., Atlanta, Edmonton, Seattle and Vancouver to the outing on which they will pay tribute to late drummer/lyricist Neil Peart. Following the previously announced kick off on June 7 with the first of four sold out shows at the Kia Forum, the band will hit Mexico City, Fort Worth, Texas, Chicago, New York and Toronto for multiple nights before hitting Philly on Aug. 21 for the first of the newly revealed shows. The tour will then move on to Little Caesars Arena in Detroit on Aug. 26, the Bell Centre in Montreal on Sept. 2 and TD Garden in Boston on Sept. 12. Fans are encouraged to sign up for a Rush artist pre-sale for the new shows here by 11:59 p.m. ET on Thursday (Oct. 23); no code is needed, with access tied to the user’s account. The artist pre-sale begins in Oct. 27 at 12 pâ€¦

items.title: BIA Talks â€˜BIANCAâ€™ Debut Album, Cardi B & Unreleased Ariana Grande Collaborations: â€˜Iâ€™m Now Representing SomethingÂ Biggerâ€™
items.summary: A decade in the making, the Massachusetts rapper released her BIANCA debut last Friday (Oct. 10), featuring Becky G, Ty Dolla $ign and Key Glock.
items.body: BIA had plenty of chances to release a debut album in the past. Many artists would dive headfirst into the opportunity to parlay momentum from a Nicki Minaj co-sign â€” which came on the Billboard Hot 100 top 20 hit “Whole Lotta Money” remix â€” or when she went toe-to-toe with J. Cole on “London” two years later in 2023. But the Massachusetts-bred rapper knew the timing wasn’t right. A testament to artist development, following a pair of EPs in the 2020s, BIA continued to refine her rap repertoire â€” and about a decade after signing to Pharrell’s I Am Other label, BIA’s BIANCA debut album arrived via Epic Records last Friday (Oct. 10). The versatile project finds BIA tapping into her Latin roots when connecting with Becky G to conquer a sample of Shakira’s classic “Hips Don’t Lie” for the party-starting “Hard Way.” She tries out The Notorious B.I.G.’s “Warning” flow on “Trifling” and shows off her vocal range while singing on tracks like “October,” as she transforms into R&BIA. BIANCA , BIA’s legal first name, serves as a juxtaposition for BIA joining the wâ€¦

items.title: LE SSERAFIM Twirls Up Saucy Collaboration With j-hope of BTS for â€˜Spaghettiâ€™ SingleÂ Album
items.summary: It'll mark the boy band singer's first team-up with a K-pop girl group.
items.body: LE SSERAFIM is cooking up an extra special song for fans on upcoming single album Spaghetti , which will feature a collaboration with j-hope of BTS . Related LE SSERAFIM Sizzles With â€˜HOTâ€™ Performance on â€˜America’s Got Talentâ€™: Watch Everything the Members of BTS Have Said About Their Upcoming Reunion LE SSERAFIM Announce Dates For 2025 North American Fall Tour As announced Monday (Oct. 20), the boy band singer will appear on the quintet’s upcoming project, marking his first-ever team-up with a K-pop girl group. The news was unveiled in an intense video teaser titled “The Kick” on YouTube, showing j-hope wearing a Matrix -esque outfit and shades while appearing underneath flashing strobe lights. At the end of the video, fans get a taste of KIM CHAEWON, SAKURA, HUH YUNJIN, KAZUHA and HONG EUNCHAE’s vocal performance with j-hope. Spaghetti is set to drop Friday (Oct. 24). It follows the release of the girl group’s Hot EP, which debuted at No. 9 on the Billboard 200 . It also comes after member HUH YUNJIN teamed up with j-hope for “I Don’t Know,” a track on the latter’s HOPE ON THE STREET VOL.1 solo EP. In addâ€¦

items.title: Red Bull Racing â€” And Music Fans â€” Win Big at the Formula 1 U.S. Grand Prix, Featuring Garth Brooks, Kygo &Â More
items.summary: America's Got Talent alum Drake Milligan also headlined F1's first-ever Grid Gigs on the race track.
items.body: Thousands of racing fans â€“ and almost as many cowboy hats — descended upon Austin, Texas, this weekend for the Formula 1 United States Grand Prix hosted by Circuit of the Americas, which featured high-energy performances from Kygo , Garth Brooks and more big-name artists. Related ‘I Shouldn’t Have Told You That’: Shaboozey Spills the Tea on His Feminist New Album & Designing an F1 Race Car ‘F1 The Album’: All 17 Tracks Ranked Atlantic Records Is Racing Toward Another Soundtrack Smash With ‘F1’: ‘It Felt Undeniable’ The Norwegian DJ was the first to take the main stage on the COTA grounds, performing Friday night (Oct. 17) just a few hours after the first sprint of race weekend, which Red Bull Racingâ€™s Max Verstappen won. Kygo delivered an electric showcase complete with colorful laser lights and pyrotechnics, packing his set with remixed versions of cross-generational hits programmed to make the swarm of racing fans crowded onto the track beneath the stage dance. The next day, Brooks closed out an action-packed itinerary that began with a sprint race and ended with an intense qualifying session, which determâ€¦

items.title: Morgan Wallen, Garth Brooks, Taylor Swift & More Artists With Most Weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums Chart: FullÂ List
items.summary: Male solo artists dominate, though three female solo artists and two groups have also achieved the feat.
items.body: Morgan Wallen â€™s I’m the Problem leads Billboard ‘s Top Country Albums chart (dated Oct. 25) for the 22nd consecutive week. This ups Wallen’s career tally of weeks at No. 1 to 208, allowing him to extend his lead as the artist with the most weeks at No. 1 in the chart’s 61-year history. Wallenâ€™s achievement is especially impressive because he has amassed this hefty total of weeks at No. 1 in such a short amount of time. He first topped the chart on Aug. 15, 2020. Top Country Albums originated as Hot Country Albums in the Jan. 11, 1964 issue of Billboard . Johnny Cash â€™s Ring of Fire (The Best of Johnny Cash) headed the inaugural chart. The compilation was well-timed: â€œRing of Fireâ€ had headed Hot Country Songs for seven weeks the previous summer and had crossed over to reach the top 20 on the Billboard Hot 100. The chart was named Hot Country LPâ€™s from 1968 to 1984, when vinyl LPs were king. Twenty-one artists have logged 50 or more weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums. Male solo artists dominate, as you might expect, though three female solo artists have achieved the feat, as have two groups. (One of those groups is an all-female group.) Only one Black artâ€¦

items.title: OnePlus reveals OnePlus 15 battery size, and it puts S25 Ultra to shame
items.summary: The OnePlus 13 already had a big battery, but the OnePlus 15 ups the ante.
items.body: Credit: OnePlus/Weibo TL;DR OnePlus has revealed the OnePlus 15â€™s battery capacity, and itâ€™ll offer a 7,300mAh battery. That means the phoneâ€™s battery is over 1,000mAh bigger than the OnePlus 13â€™s battery. The upcoming flagship will also offer 120W wired and 50W wireless charging. OnePlus will officially launch the OnePlus 15 in China next week, and the company has already revealed display specs and a few colors. Now, OnePlus has revealed the phoneâ€™s battery and charging specs. OnePlus confirmed on Weibo that the OnePlus 15 will have a 7,300mAh battery. Thatâ€™s a significant upgrade over the OnePlus 13â€™s 6,000mAh battery, and a gigantic upgrade over phones like the Galaxy S25 Ultra (5,000mAh).

items.title: The Samsung Galaxy S25 FE is a good upgrade for anyone but newer FE owners
items.summary: A few long overdue upgrades, and a couple we're still waiting on.
items.body: The Galaxy S20 FE marked the debut of the Fan Edition for Samsung, and it was a sensation upon its release back in 2020. It was a genuine flagship-tier Android phone that didnâ€™t break the bank. Iâ€™ve long felt like subsequent releases have failed to live up to that initial device, as the Galaxy maker chose penny-pinching conservatism over a truly exciting product. Samsung has recently released the Galaxy S25 FE (), and Iâ€™ve spent just over two weeks with it. The good news is that the company is stepping up its game with a couple of long-overdue upgrades. But is this enough to make the phone worth buying? Letâ€™s dive into our Galaxy S25 FE review.

items.title: Sri Lanka's Dilhari is stumped in bizarre fashion
items.summary: Sri Lanka's Kavisha Dilhari is stumped by Bangladesh's Nigar Sultana Joty in the most "unfortunate" way as the ball is deflected onto the wicketkeeper's legs before it ricochets onto the stumps.

items.title: Watch this sub-$100 dual-screen Android gaming handheld play DS and 3DS games
items.summary: It's not original hardware, but these emulation handhelds have come a long, long way.
items.body: TL;DR The ANBERNIC RG DS is a new dual-screen handheld with a DS Lite form factor. A new video showcases not just Nintendo DS emulation, but also lightweight 3DS emulation. Details are still slim, but it will retail for less than $100. ANBERNIC has put out some very interesting Android gaming handhelds this year, like the PSP Go-inspired RG Slide , but the RG DS takes the cake. In a year thatâ€™s largely been defined by expensive dual-screen handhelds like the AYANEO Pocket DS and AYN Thor , this device finally brings the price below $100. A new video uploaded over the weekend finally shows the device in action, and despite the affordable price, it looks like it will be capable of much more than just DS games. The video shows off gameplay in two 3DS games: Rune Factory 4 and Shovel Knight. The former had some minor audio tearing, but otherwise gameplay seemed smooth.

items.title: Boulter's poor run continues with first-round loss
items.summary: British number three Katie Boulter continues her poor run of form with defeat by German Eva Lys in the second round of the Pan Pacific Open.

items.title: This new â€˜Liteâ€™ PC emulator removes sketchy permissions and trackers
items.summary: GameHub has no shortage of trackers, analytics, and heavy-handed permissions, but GameHub Lite is to the rescue.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR GameHub Lite has been released as an alternative to the GameHub PC emulator for Android. This is a reverse-engineered project that strips away GameHubâ€™s trackers and extensive permissions. Controller brand GameSir launched the GameHub app early this year, allowing you to run PC games directly on your Android phone without an internet connection. There have been some privacy concerns about this app, but an enterprising developer has launched GameHub Lite to assuage these concerns. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Itâ€™s been 5 months since I left T-Mobile, and I have no regrets
items.summary: I'd say I made the right call.
items.body: Earlier this year, I made a pretty drastic change in mobile carriers. After 10 years of being subscribed to T-Mobile , I decided it was time to call it quits and switch to a different provider. I moved not only myself, but also my partner and some of my family members to Visible, and thatâ€™s where weâ€™ve been ever since. Fast forward to today, and itâ€™s officially been over five months since T-Mobile and I parted ways. Now that the honeymoon phase with Visible is over and Iâ€™ve had time to really assess things, whatâ€™s my conclusion? Was the switch worth it?

items.title: Salt & Brook set up impressive England win over NZ
items.summary: England crush New Zealand by 65 runs in the second T20 in Christchurch to give the tourists a 1-0 series lead with one match to play.

items.title: Sri Lanka's Gunaratne trapped lbw first ball
items.summary: Sri Lanka's Vishmi Gunaratne is trapped lbw by Bangladesh's Marufa Akter on the first ball of their match in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup.

items.title: â€˜Ok Googleâ€™ can die; this is my favorite new way to talk to Gemini
items.summary: The Pixel Watch 4's new gesture makes talking to Gemini more seamless than ever.
items.body: The Pixel Watch 4 has won me over with its longer battery life, faster charging, better repairability, and absolutely gorgeous new display, but one feature I keep finding myself swooning over is the new raise-to-talk gesture to invoke Gemini. I can simply raise my wrist in the direction of my head, and the Pixel Watch will immediately trigger a blue Gemini animation, telling me itâ€™s ready to listen to my question or command. I love this so much that itâ€™s reduced my usage of Nest speakers and hubs around the house because it doesnâ€™t require the dreaded â€œOk Googleâ€ first.

items.title: One of the best Android Auto dongles now plays nice with Apple CarPlay
items.summary: One adapter, two platforms, zero cables.
items.body: TL;DR The AAWireless Two Plus just launched, adding Apple CarPlay support to the popular Android Auto adapter. It offers quick setup, easy phone switching, and automatic reconnection when you return to the car. The device is available now in the US and EU, with a UK launch coming soon. The startup behind one of our favorite Android Auto dongles has launched a new model that finally works for both major phone ecosystems. The new AAWireless Two Plus adapter brings wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay connectivity to cars that only support wired connections.

items.title: AAWireless TWO+ turns wired Android Auto and CarPlay wireless, available today
items.summary: After a soft launch earlier this year, AAWireless TWO+ is now available as the companyâ€™s first wireless adapter fully ready for both Android Auto and CarPlay. moreâ€¦

items.title: What would Dyche bring to Forest?
items.summary: Match of the Day's Mark Chapman, Troy Deeney and Shay Given discuss what former Burnley and Everton boss Sean Dyche might bring to struggling Nottingham Forest.

items.title: Forest in advanced talks to appoint Dyche
items.summary: Nottingham Forest are in advanced talks to appoint Sean Dyche as their manager - would he be a more natural fit at the City Ground?

items.title: A ton of services are down or facing issues right now (Update: Fixes applied)
items.summary: Update: Services affected by AWS issues should be coming back online now.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Users on a variety of websites and services are reporting outages and connectivity issues today. Affected services include Snapchat, Grammarly, Prime Video, Signal, Asana, and Slack. AWS has confirmed an issue and that itâ€™s applied fixes for the problem. Update: October 20, 2025 (5:30 AM ET): Amazon has updated its AWS dashboard to confirm that it has applied fixes for the issue. The firm said it applied â€œinitial mitigationsâ€ and noticed early signs of a recovery. â€œWe are seeing significant signs of recovery. Most requests should now be succeeding. We continue to work through a backlog of queued requests. We will continue to provide additional information,â€ the company added in a subsequent update.

items.title: Is Reddit not working? Here are some fixes you can try!
items.summary: Here's some tips to get Reddit up and running again.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Itâ€™s nowhere close to Google, YouTube, or Facebook, but Reddit stays firm on the list of the most popular websites in the world. The network covers pretty much any subject, and has a strong following. The community is known for its loyalty, so we can understand how frustrating it can be when you have problems with Reddit not working. This rarely happens, so it might come as a shock. An outage is often the cause, but it could also be an external problem. Hereâ€™s a quick guide on how to fix any issues you might experience.

items.title: I wish Google didnâ€™t make smartphones
items.summary: Pixel is good for Google, but not for Android.
items.body: While I always welcome more competition in the Android smartphone market, one key player I havenâ€™t been so happy about is Google. At first, I was interested to see what Google could do and the potential that more stock Android smartphones could offer. But over time, that interest has turned into concern â€” to the point that I actually wish Google didnâ€™t make smartphones. This isnâ€™t due to the hardware itself or even Google as a company, but rather Googleâ€™s position as the primary developer of Android.

items.title: 'A proud club dragged into gutter' - Rangers fans on manager search
items.summary: Kevin Muscat is the latest to be ruled out of Rangers' manager search - so what do fans make of the process, and who do they want now?

items.title: Gemini for TV appears on another new device, and itâ€™s still not the Google TV Streamer
items.summary: Gemini creeps its way onto another Google TV set.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A user has encountered a setup screen Gemini for Google TV on their Sony Bravia TV. The screen appeared after they updated their Google TV Home app. This is the first instance of Gemini for TV running on a device beyond TCLâ€™s premier televisions. Thereâ€™s still no word on when Gemini for TV will roll out to Googleâ€™s own devices. In September, Google began rolling out Gemini to Google TV products, as promised in May, but initially, only one device received the next-generation assistant. Now, it seems that support for additional devices may be imminent. A Reddit user, u/Proshis_Saha_Swopna , discovered the Gemini setup screen on their Sony Bravia TV running Android TV 14 after updating the Google TV Home app via the Play Store.

items.title: 'Humbled but inspired' - Potter named Sweden boss
items.summary: Former West Ham manager Graham Potter is named as the new head coach of Sweden.

items.title: Consign my Ashes try to history - Davies' England challenge
items.summary: Thirty-one years ago this week, Jonathan Davies scored arguably Wembley's greatest-ever try. This Saturday, he wants to see England produce a memorable moment to match it.

items.summary: Match of the Day pundit and ex-Aston Villa goalkeeper Shay Given describes Emiliano Buendia's winning goal in Villa's 2-1 win over Tottenham in the Premier League as "world class".

items.summary: In the first of a new series of From the Ashes, Stuart Broad reflects on his legendary career, including battles with David Warner, his 8-15 and fairytale farewell.

items.summary: British-record signing Alexander Isak is doing enough to justify starting ahead of Hugo Ekitike for Liverpool, says former England striker Wayne Rooney.

items.summary: Great Britain's women are targeting a third straight team pursuit world title in Chile this month.

items.summary: Wales head coach Steve Tandy, about to pick his first squad, is described as "beautiful" and "awesome" by Filo Tiatia.

items.summary: Former Real Madrid and Everton winger Royston Drenthe is in hospital after suffering a stroke.

items.summary: In a landmark public health achievement, Fiji has been validated by the World Health Organization (WHO) for eliminating trachoma as a public health problem. Trachoma, a neglected tropical disease (NTD) and the worldâ€™s leading infectious cause of blindness, no longer poses a public health threat in â€¦

items.title: I brought Nova Launcherâ€™s best feature to my new launcher, but I donâ€™t think you should
items.summary: Three years since its last update, Sesame is no longer at the peak of its power.
items.body: Saying that Nova Launcher had a profound impact on the Android we know and love today would be an understatement. The launcher endured over a dozen operating system versions and opened up a universe of customization to users. Not only that, it also made app search and discovery a huge part of its functionality, forcing competing launchers to up their game. These smarts are largely thanks to Sesame Shortcuts . Although Nova Launcherâ€™s death knell has already sounded, my recent thoughts have turned to Sesame Shortcutsâ€™ dim future. But, for now at least, you can still integrate the powerful search app in your new Android launcher. Hereâ€™s how to do it, why you might want to think twice about it, and what you should consider before doing it.

items.title: 5 ways the Galaxy Z Fold 7 beats the Pixel 10 Pro Fold
items.summary: One is the future, the other is history repeating itself.
items.body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority Itâ€™s been an exciting year for foldable phones, thanks largely to the Galaxy Z Fold 7 . Itâ€™s a phone I havenâ€™t been able to put down since launch. Itâ€™s not my daily driver, but itâ€™s become my go-to work phone, the one that always draws a few too many stares for my liking. This is the year Samsung reclaimed mastery over the form factor and reminded everyone that foldables arenâ€™t a fad, theyâ€™re the future.

items.title: I tried Apple SharePlay, and now Googleâ€™s version feels like a beta test
items.summary: Google has a LOT of work to do.
items.body: SharePlay isnâ€™t new. Itâ€™s been around on Apple devices for a few years now, allowing you to team up with friends or family to watch something together, syncing video streams over a video call. Itâ€™s a handy tool when your loved ones arenâ€™t in the same location. As with everything Apple, you canâ€™t use it outside of the walled garden, so Android users are left out. To counter that, Google made its own version of SharePlay (I donâ€™t blame you if youâ€™ve never heard of it), but it leaves you wanting more â€” much more. After a moment of using it, I thought, â€œThatâ€™s it? Thatâ€™s all it does?â€

items.title: These 6 lesser-known free apps make my life easier
items.summary: Sometimes, focused is better.
items.body: For a while, I wanted to keep my phone as streamlined as possible, only keeping my essential apps installed. But this year has been a tough one and keeping track of everything mentally has been getting more difficult to do. I decided to start leaning on some niche apps, while not adding on additional subscriptions, to help me keep track of everything. Overall, it has proven to be a positive change. While not every app Iâ€™ve tried has been a hit, these six have proven to be hidden gems that make my life easier.

items.title: Whatever you do, donâ€™t buy these 6 Google gadgets right now
items.summary: The stinkers of the Google Store.
items.body: As the weather gets colder and the days get shorter, that can only mean one thing: fall is officially here. Not only is this the time for pumpkin spice lattes and haunted houses, but thereâ€™s also a good chance youâ€™re starting to think about your upcoming holiday shopping. And if youâ€™re an Android fan, youâ€™re probably going to do some of that shopping on the Google Store. Front and center on the Google Store today are all of Googleâ€™s latest releases â€” including the Pixel 10 , Pixel 10 Pro , Pixel Watch 4 , and the shockingly good Pixel Buds 2a . Theyâ€™re the best of what Google has to offer, and theyâ€™re likely what youâ€™re visiting the Google Store for.

items.title: Itâ€™s time for Samsung to ditch the Galaxy Store
items.summary: The Galaxy Store is broken, irrelevant, and still full of ads â€” it's time to move on.
items.body: Samsungâ€™s Galaxy Store has been around for a long time, and itâ€™s where youâ€™d go to download and update Samsung apps, Galaxy Themes, apps for your Tizen smartwatch, and more. In recent years, however, the Galaxy Store has become less relevant, and today itâ€™s little more than an annoyance that lives in a forgotten folder on my Galaxy S25 . Itâ€™s time for Samsung to cut its losses and move everything to the Play Store. Pop-ups and failed updates

items.title: Amazon says the Kindle Colorsoft isnâ€™t great for reading books, and I agree
items.summary: Color me unsurprised.
items.body: Amazon rarely undercuts its own products, but when the company quietly slipped a caveat into the FAQ for its new Colorsoft Kindle , it made one thing abundantly clear: if you care about crisp, black-and-white reading, buy something else. As someone who still acts like theyâ€™ll earn a pizza party if they read enough books, I spend a lot of time with my Kindle. Amazonâ€™s honest take doesnâ€™t surprise me (and wonâ€™t surprise anyone whoâ€™s read on both types of e-reader), but itâ€™s a rare day I find myself agreeing with the company about anything. Kindle Colorsoftâ€™s honest fine print

items.title: A new (artificial) era for Google Photos
items.summary: Thanks to AI and XR, Google Photos is entering a new era of content creation - for better or worse.
items.body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_ZF42Sm4Gq0 This week, Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown dive into a suite of upcoming Google Photos features that could change how we create and remember our favorite moments. They discuss new AI-powered highlight video templates that automate editing, the controversial introduction of face-retouching tools, and the exciting prospect of reliving memories in a 3D spatial environment with a new generation of Android XR headsets. The Authority Insights Podcast is a new weekly show from the Android Authority team hosted by Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown. In each episode, weâ€™ll break down the latest exclusive reports, app teardowns, and leaks from the Android Authority team.

items.title: Google is preparing big screen recording upgrades for Android tablets and PCs
items.summary: Google is adding a toolbar, selfie camera capture, and more features to Androidâ€™s screen recorder.
items.body: If you want to share your Android phoneâ€™s screen content, you have a few options: take a screenshot , cast the screen, or record it with the built-in screen recorder. The screen recorder has been around for a couple of years now, but itâ€™s still fairly basic. Despite receiving a few new features in recent years, it lacks many quality-of-life improvements found in other operating systems. Now, in preparation for Android coming to PCs , Google is working on a major upgrade to the feature. Hereâ€™s an early look. Youâ€™re reading the Authority Insights Newsletter , a weekly newsletter that reveals some new facet of Android that hasnâ€™t been reported on anywhere else. If youâ€™re looking for the latest scoops, the hottest leaks, and breaking news on Googleâ€™s Android operating system and other mobile tech topics, then weâ€™ve got you covered.

items.title: Iâ€™m a Pixel and foldable fan, but the Pixel 10 Pro Fold isnâ€™t for me
items.summary: How badly do you want a foldable Pixel?
items.body: The Google Pixel 10 Pro Fold is a very good foldable. Itâ€™s the first folding phone with an IP68 rating and built-in magnetic charging. Staples like a good hinge, reliable battery life, quality screens, and well-made software are all present. By all of those accounts, the Pixel 10 Pro Fold should be an easy recommendation. And yet, I think itâ€™s the most challenging model to recommend out of the entire Pixel 10 series.

items.title: Itâ€™s the little things: 4 quality-of-life updates I want to see in Gemini
items.summary: The AI chatbot can be vastly improved with minimal effort.
items.body: Credit: Megan Ellis / Android Authority Gemini is one of my favorite apps, but thereâ€™s definitely room for improvement. I want to see changes, but Iâ€™m not talking about anything super substantial here. Sure, we all want tools like Gemini to be faster, more engaging, and 100% factual, but thatâ€™s not the point of this post. I want to highlight a few smaller changes that I personally want to see that would drastically elevate the experience with Googleâ€™s AI chatbot. Donâ€™t be weird, Gemini

items.title: This Android launcher goes all in on widgets, and I absolutely love it
items.summary: I came from Niagara and Iâ€™m not sure I want to go back.
items.body: Iâ€™ve used almost every major Android launcher in recent years, some for a few days for testing purposes and others for years as the backbone of my smartphoneâ€™s home screen. These launchers range from the now-deprecated Nova Launcher to hot new properties like Octopi Launcher . Through it all, Iâ€™ve settled on Niagara Launcher thanks to its minimalist, productivity-focused design, which Iâ€™ve thoughtfully integrated into my daily workflow. However, as readers know, Iâ€™m always ready to reevaluate my choices and consider better alternatives. Today, Iâ€™m exploring AIO Launcher . Although Iâ€™ve seen many users recommend this app across various online forums, I havenâ€™t spent much time exploring all its features. And wow, thereâ€™s a lot to uncover here. Not a smooth transition At its core, AIO Launcher is unlike any other home screen on the market. Itâ€™s decidedly different from traditional products like Nova Launcher and Smart Launcher, but I canâ€™t quite compare it to other niche launchers. The best way to describe it is as an amalgamation of Kvaesitsoâ€™s endless scrolling home screen and Niagara Launcherâ€™s app drawer, but this isnâ€™t a bang-on description.

items.title: Weâ€™ve tested the best phones with an IR blaster, and these are the ones you should buy in 2025
items.summary: These are your best smartphone options if you're in need of an infrared blaster.
items.body: There was a time when smartphones packed everything and the kitchen sink, including headphone jacks, removable batteries, notification LEDs, and IR blasters. While those first three have largely fallen by the wayside, there are a few notable Android smartphones that still include the infrared projector. IR blasters are super useful for controlling other devices, like TVs and audio equipment. Weâ€™ve tested a slew of Android phones in 2025, but only a handful include IR blasters that are worth your time. Iâ€™ve narrowed your choices based on use cases, price points, and unique selling points.

items.title: 3 carriers with international features that rival Google Fi
items.summary: Visible, US Mobile, and Total all offer some advantages over Google Fi. Of course, none of these are perfect.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Google Fi has long been the go-to choice for travelers thanks to its unlimited plans with international roaming and calling perks. In fact, it often outperforms even the most expensive options from the big three postpaid carriers. The downside is that Fiâ€™s â€œunlimitedâ€ data is not truly unlimited, with speeds dropping dramatically after 30 to 100GB of use. Add in premium pricing and a mixed reputation for customer service, and it is clear Google Fi is not perfect. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Is AT&T down for you? Youâ€™re not alone (Update: Resolved)
items.summary: AT&T is currently experiencing issues.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR AT&T users are reporting that the service is down. It appears the reports began as early as this morning, but now the reports are spiking. Update: October 17, 2025 (7:58 PM ET): After a brief outage, it appears that AT&Tâ€™s network is starting to return to normal. Original article: October 17, 2025 (5:17 PM ET): If youâ€™re an AT&T customer and youâ€™re having trouble with the service, youâ€™re not alone. A growing number of users are reporting that the network is experiencing an outage.

items.title: Google Play spills the beans on what apps and games are coming to Android XR
items.summary: The Galaxy XR may not be out yet, but the Play Store isn't waiting around.
items.body: TL;DR A new Play Store section highlights apps and games built for Android XR. Titles spotted include Asteroid, Vacation Simulator, and NFL Pro Era. Virtual Desktop has also appeared, hinting at PCVR streaming support for the platform. The big Galaxy XR headset reveal is just around the corner, but Google seems unconcerned about syncing everything perfectly with Samsungâ€™s timing. A section on the Play Store has popped up showcasing â€œimmersive experiences made for your XR headset,â€ giving us a decent idea of whatâ€™s on the way for Android XR. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google Messages rolling out account menu redesign
items.summary: The account menu was the last non-Material 3 Expressive aspect of Google Messages and it has now been updated. moreâ€¦

items.title: The next version of Google Gemini could be just around the corner (Update: Maybe not?)
items.summary: An announcement could happen in the very near future.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR A leak may have revealed when Google plans to launch Gemini 3.0. The leak suggests weâ€™ll get an announcement on Oct 22, 2025. Update, October 17, 2025 (05:16 PM ET): It hasnâ€™t even been a week yet since we looked at this possible leak into a Gemini 3.0 ETA, and now a new source is throwing just a lot of cold water on those claims. The site Sources reports that contrary to what we just heard, Google will stick with the same December launch for Gemini 3.0 that it used for Gemini 2.0 and Gemini 1.0 before it.

items.title: Pixelated 074: Is the ultra-slim smartphone race already over?
items.summary: Welcome to episode 74 of Pixelated, a podcast by 9to5Google. This week, Abner, Damien, and Will turn their attention to the rumored cancellation of next yearâ€™s Galaxy S26 Edge. The trio discuss what this means for the S25 Edgeâ€™s poor sales, and how it relates to Samsungâ€™s ongoing strategy of tryingâ€¦

items.title: That weird camera gimbal â€˜Robot Phoneâ€™ might actually go up for sale next year
items.summary: The hardware could be a lot further along than its AI-looking video suggested.
items.body: TL;DR Earlier this week, HONOR teased a phone with a unique camera gimbal arm. While the company said weâ€™d see more at MWC, the very AI-looking nature of the video left it unclear how far along this project is. A new source claims that work on the prototype is 80% complete. In 2025, telling the difference between whatâ€™s real and whatâ€™s not can feel like a Sisyphean task. Generative AI tools are becoming more sophisticated every day, and while lots of AI content is still easy to spot, who knows how much youâ€™re missing? Earlier this week we checked out one of the most impressive-looking phone hardware teasers weâ€™ve seen in a minute, but was it even real? Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: A Nothing Phone 1 user may have figured out how to get Android 16 on their device
items.summary: The port is reportedly not ready for everyone yet.
items.body: Credit: Oliver Cragg / Android Authority TL;DR A developer claims to have successfully installed Nothing OS 4.0 on a Phone 1. Everything reportedly works, including the new Camera app and its presets. There are a few issues, like the clock in the status bar not being correctly aligned. Although Android 16 has been available on Pixels for a while now, many other Android phones are just now starting to get a taste. For example, Nothing recently rolled out the Nothing OS 4.0 beta , which is based on Android 16. This beta is only available for the Phone 2, Phone 2a, Phone 2a Pro, Phone 3, and eventually the Phone 3a. However, it appears a developer may have found a way to get the OS running on a Phone 1. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: OnePlus tries to show OxygenOS 16 is snappier than One UI, but somethingâ€™s fishy
items.summary: Skill issue.
items.body: TL;DR OnePlus has detailed its upcoming OxygenOS 16 update. A head-to-head comparison with Samsung One UI was meant to show that OnePlusâ€™s software is more respsonsive. Closer viewing shows One UI failed to keep pace largely due to user error. OnePlusâ€™s latest OxygenOS 16 update is set to begin rolling out broadly next month . The update will bring a bunch of new features , including, OnePlus says, enhancements to its Parallel Processing, which is meant to make opening and switching apps feel faster. In a video showcasing the new update, OnePlus compared the app switching experience in OxygenOS to Samsungâ€™s One UI â€” but the demo seemed intentionally dishonest. As flagged by uyagoda_ on Threads, a split-screen pitting OxygenOS 16 against Samsung One UI (labeled â€œOther Flagship UIâ€) appears to show a Samsung phone hanging as a game loads while the OnePlus phone next to it continued to fly through cycling in and out of various apps. At a glance, it looks bad for Samsung, but on closer inspection, the One UI hiccup was pretty clearly user error.

items.title: Google Maps might finally let you personalize your vehicle before hitting the road

items.body: TL;DR In the latest Google Maps build, we managed to enable a setting that lets you choose your Driving avatar in the settings menu. Right now, you can only change the icon from the navigation screen. Choosing it before setting off would mean you can give the road your full focus. Google Maps already lets you swap that little blue arrow for something that feels a bit more like your own ride, whether thatâ€™s a sporty hatchback or a pickup truck. The catch is that you can only do it once navigation has started. However, weâ€™ve unearthed clues that this might be about to change. items.summary: QPR2 Beta 3 testers are going to ridiculous lengths save their phones.
items.body: TL;DR Google has pulled Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 due to the risk of it bootlooping phones with desktop settings enabled. Users who already installed the update have been looking for solutions to escape the loop without a factory reset. A method involving plugging and unplugging USB peripherals has proved fruitful, but can be very slow to get results. Trying out beta software means accepting some level of risk, but how much do you really expect to break when running an Android beta? Maybe Google Wallet stops working? Fingerprint sensor shuts down? A few app crashes, sure, but most of the time Google still manages to give us a largely functional piece of software. That may be true, but this week was apparently the exception that proves the rule, as Google was forced to pump the brakes on Android 16 QPR2 Beta 3 following reports of some seriously phone-breaking glitches. The Miyoo Mini Flip has the same 2.8-inch screen as 2021â€™s Miyoo Mini, but apart from that, the company hasnâ€™t announced specs or pricing. items.body: Iâ€™ve encountered a bouquet of incredible new Android apps this year, from small utilities that bolster my productivity to genuine problem solvers that make the platform better. Not every Android app has or will survive to see the new year, though. As 2025 draws to a swift close and I scroll through the remaining apps pinned to my drawer, I canâ€™t help but remember those wares that once formed a core part of my Android experience and that were sunset this year. Many of these apps Iâ€™ve used religiously in the past, and Iâ€™ll certainly miss them going forward. Iâ€™ll miss these five dead Android apps in particular.

items.title: Hereâ€™s when Samsung will ditch Microsoft for photo backups
items.summary: Samsung reportedly marks April 11, 2026, as breakup day for One UI Gallery and OneDrive.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR Samsungâ€™s Gallery app will reportedly stop syncing with OneDrive on April 11, 2026. Users will be encouraged to move their photo backups to Samsung Cloud instead. The change strengthens Samsungâ€™s ecosystem as it phases out Microsoft integration. Samsungâ€™s plan to end OneDrive integration in its Gallery app now has a date. According to a screenshot shared by X user Nirmal Sri , the feature is set to stop working on April 11, 2026. Once the cutoff arrives, users will no longer be able to sync their photos or videos from Samsung Gallery directly to OneDrive, with the company steering them toward Samsung Cloud instead. According to the report, Samsung has canceled its upcoming Galaxy S26 Edge and will release the Galaxy S26 Plus instead. The Edge was supposed to replace the Plus in next yearâ€™s Galaxy S family, but those plans are now apparently scrapped. The report cites extremely low sales of the Galaxy S25 Edge as the reason for the S26 Edgeâ€™s cancellation. This isnâ€™t the first time weâ€™ve heard of poor Edge sales , and Samsung seemingly doesnâ€™t want to risk repeating itself in 2026.

items.title: This is the the main upgrade I want to see on the Pixel 10a
items.summary: Ditch the plastic, Google.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority Iâ€™m in love with my Pixel 9a. I switched over to Googleâ€™s mid-ranger after using flagship phones for more than a decade, and I regret nothing. The phone has plenty of power, offers a brilliant software experience with seven years of updates, and is very affordable at its launch price of $500. However, there is one thing that bothers me about it. One thing Iâ€™d like Google to change with the Pixel 10a , and itâ€™s not what you think. I donâ€™t care for a larger display, the fancy camera setup from the Pixel 10 Pro , or anything else that will drastically increase the price. What I want is to get the feeling of a premium phone back, which I lost when I switched to the Pixel 9a.

items.title: Gemini can basically use Google Sheets for you now
items.summary: Google says this will 'save valuable time in your workday,' so you can... do more spreadsheets, probably?
items.body: TL;DR Gemini can now do more intricate work inside Google Sheets. You can now request complex, multi-stage edits in a single prompt. This upgraded functionality is available now on qualifying accounts. Last month, Google Sheets picked up additional Gemini functionality , gaining the ability call on Googleâ€™s AI to do things like explain how formulas work and automatically correct errors in formatting. Today, Googleâ€™s announced that Gemini can now do even more in Sheets, carrying out increasingly complex tasks on your behalf. In a blog post, Google has shared that new Gemini integration in Sheets can automate actions that involve multiple discrete steps. You can now make longer, more complicated Gemini requests in Sheets to, for example, add a new column that populates with a formula dealing with inputs you define, or to add, delete, or rearrange columns, rows, and cells however you see fit.

Android offers built-in unknown tracker detection for users interested in protecting themselves. Oh, paranoia! Everyoneâ€™s always â€œrelax, donâ€™t worry so muchâ€ until something happens to them . And if weâ€™ve got access to the tools that might prevent those bad things from happening in the first place, shouldnâ€™t we remember to be using them? Thatâ€™s exactly what weâ€™re thinking about this week, as we get an update on a scary home invasion case that appears to have involved tracking the victims via AirTag. items.title: Google Wallet is finally getting a home for your Play Points

items.body: TL;DR The Google Play Store has implemented a Play Points loyalty system for earning discounts. So far, youâ€™ve managed your Play Points directly through the Play Store app. Now Google Wallet has started giving users the option to add Play Points as a loyalty card. Google Wallet is far more than just a place to keep your credit cards, and the app has evolved into a digital card hub thatâ€™s truly worthy of its name, carrying everything from travel passes to loyalty cards. That latter addition is one weâ€™ve seen the app been giving some special attention to this year, building out tools to help you keep them current and surface the right one at the right time . items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is reportedly running a new $830 â€œany conditionâ€ trade-in offer (Promo R339) that began on October 2 and includes many older Android and iPhone models. The promo seems targeted mainly at legacy Simple Choice users, giving older plan holders a rare chance to qualify for a major deal. Unfortunately, it isnâ€™t listed in the T-Life app for most users, and must be confirmed through a rep (call or text 611). T-Mobile might offer a wide range of phone deals and promotions, but most of the time, there are clear restrictions on who is eligible. Some deals require a higher-end plan to qualify, but nearly every offer requires at least a current entry-level plan. This usually means customers with older, legacy plans are left out in the dark. Thankfully, every once in a while, an offer comes along that even older plans like Simple Choice can take advantage of. While pricing is not yet available, the app promises savings over separate subscriptions. Users will have to manually cancel their existing subscriptions first if signed up through third parties. Update, October 16, 2025 (12:11 PM ET): We saw this one coming a couple weeks ago, and today Apple and NBCUniversal are making the bundle official: Starting October 20, youâ€™ll be able to subscribe to both Apple TV and Peacock Premium for just about $15 a month, or Apple TV and Peacock Premium Plus for $20. Original article, October 3, 2025 (11:04 AM ET): Youâ€™d be forgiven for wincing a little anytime you see the name of one of your favorite streaming services pop in a news feed, as how often is it good news? If itâ€™s not upcoming shows being shelved over fears of upsetting just the worst people, itâ€™s news of price hike after price hike driving up your monthly bills. Today weâ€™d love to break from that pattern with some actual good news â€” even if we donâ€™t quite have all the salient details just yet.

Templates arenâ€™t available yet, but could roll out soon. Google Photos is picking up some new tricks to make it easier to create more expressive highlight videos. The app can already splice together clips around a certain theme to make short-form videos about your own life, and now, weâ€™ve found evidence that that capability is expanding. Experimenting with version 7.50 of the Google Photos app on Android, we managed to enable an updated version of the highlight video editor. This new iteration comes with a bunch of new templates that include pre-selected music, as well as the option to add custom text overlays.

items.title: Miss your Xperia Play? You need to see this magnetic sliding Bluetooth controller
items.summary: This viral Kickstarter controller is finally out of crowdfunding, and it looks incredible.
items.body: Credit: Ohsnap TL;DR MCON, a unique sliding mobile controller that attaches via magnets, is now available for purchase. It features TMR sticks, analog triggers, gyro controls, flip-out handles, an optional dock for external displays, and more. Initially funded via Kickstarter, it will be available later today to pre-order for $149.99 on the Ohsnap website. Mobile controllers have become more popular over the years as more controller-compatible Android games, emulators, and cloud gaming applications have hit the market. Most are simple telescopic controllers, but MCON is the first option in years with an entirely new design. With a look that harkens back to sliding handhelds like the PSP Go, Xperia Play, or even the recent ANBERNIC RG Slide , MCON attaches to the back of your phone via MagSafe magnets, then slides out with a spring-loaded â€œswitchbladeâ€ mechanism in the back. This allows it to tuck away neatly when not in use, while still providing full-size controls when you need them.

items.title: Poll: Was Samsung right to cancel the Galaxy S26 Edge?
items.summary: Is five months enough time to judge the success of a new flagship phone line?
items.body: Samsung took a swing at the thin-and-light smartphones category with the Galaxy S25 Edge , releasing the phone before Apple could release the iPhone Air . Shockingly, mere five months after its launch, reports suggest that Samsung has killed the Edge line . That means no further production of the Galaxy S25 Edge beyond existing stock, and no plans to launch its successor, the Galaxy S26 Edge. One can argue that five months is too short a period to judge the performance of a phone line. So, was Samsung right to cancel the Galaxy S26 Edge? Reports suggest that the Galaxy S25 Edge sold only 1.31 million units since its launch in May, up to August. The first three months after launch are where most smartphone sales are concentrated, so this was seemingly enough of a runway for Samsung to assess the S25 Edgeâ€™s sales performance. In contrast, the Galaxy S25, S25 Plus, and S25 Ultra sold 8.28 million, 5.05 million, and 12.18 million units, respectively, as of August. Even the lowest-selling S25 Plus sold many times more than the Edge, but with the advantage of having launched earlier in the year.

Update: Oct 16, 2025 (09:15 AM ET): We were able to reverse engineer the latest beta build to get a glimpse of how DMs in ChatGPT could work. While itâ€™s not functional at the moment, we can see that ChatGPT lets you share individual responses as well as the entire chat with others. We also see the option to block other users. items.title: Hate your phoneâ€™s camera island design? This flagship lets you swap it out like Lego
items.summary: And it's arriving next week in China, with a global launch to follow soon.
items.body: Credit: Realme TL;DR Realme just teased a key design element for the upcoming GT 8 Pro flagship. Its camera island can be swapped out for a different shape or color. The phone also features special color tuning by camera brand Ricoh and is realmeâ€™s first phone with a special partnership. Innovation is dead, one could easily argue in the context of phone designs. In addition to the glass slab becoming widely accepted as the standard design for a big chunk of smartphones made and sold today, the fast lane launches and the constant battle to uproot competition have led manufacturers to focus on other areas than design. At the same time, certain outliers, like Nothing, challenge that notion by experimenting with unusual camera designs , secondary displays , and unusually tiny screens . Now, another leading Android manufacturer is experimenting with a subtle change that can radically alter the phoneâ€™s look by altering how the camera appears. OnePlusâ€™ sister brand, realme, has just begun teasing its upcoming flagship with a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 . In addition to the new chipset, the realme GT 8 Pro is also the brandâ€™s first phone to feature a camera developed in partnership with a caâ€¦

items.title: WHO upgrades its public health intelligence system to boost global health security
items.summary: Today, the World Health Organization (WHO), in collaboration with key partners and supporters, launched version 2.0 of the Epidemic Intelligence from Open Sources (EIOS) system, used globally for the early detection of public health threats.

items.title: Maldives becomes the first country to achieve â€˜triple eliminationâ€™ of mother-to-child transmission of HIV, syphilis and hepatitis B
items.summary: In a landmark public health achievement, the World Health Organization (WHO) has validated the Maldives for eliminating mother-to-child transmission (EMTCT) of hepatitis B, while maintaining its earlier validation (in 2019) for EMTCT of HIV and syphilis.

items.title: WHO warns of widespread resistance to common antibiotics worldwide
items.summary: One in six laboratory-confirmed bacterial infections causing common infections in people worldwide in 2023 were resistant to antibiotic treatments, according to a new World Health Organization (WHO) report launched today. Between 2018 and 2023, antibiotic resistance rose in over 40% of the pathogenâ€¦

items.title: WHO tobacco trends report: 1 in 5 adults still addicted to tobacco
items.summary: The world is smoking less, but the tobacco epidemic is far from over. A new WHO global report shows the number of tobacco users has dropped from 1.38 billion in 2000 to 1.2 billion in 2024. Since 2010, the number of people using tobacco has dropped by 120 million â€“ a 27% drop in relative terms. Yetâ€¦

items.title: Global health agencies issue new recommendations to help end deaths from postpartum haemorrhage

items.title: Recommendations announced for influenza vaccine composition for the 2026 southern hemisphere influenza season
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today announced its recommendations for the viral composition of influenza vaccines for use in the 2026 influenza season in the southern hemisphere. The announcement was made at an Information Meeting after a 4-day Consultation on the Composition of Influenza Virâ€¦

items.title: Member States advance vital work in support of WHO Pandemic Agreement
items.summary: WHO Member States are actively progressing with the development of the Pathogens Access and Benefit Sharing (PABS) system, a key component of the WHO Pandemic Agreement aimed at ensuring equitable and timely sharing of pathogen materials and related benefits. This work follows the historic adoptionâ€¦

items.title: WHO statement on autism-related issues
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) emphasizes that there is currently no conclusive scientific evidence confirming a possible link between autism and use of acetaminophen (also known as paracetamol) during pregnancy. Globally, nearly 62 million people (1 in 127) have autism spectrum disorder, a diâ€¦

items.title: Uncontrolled high blood pressure puts over a billion people at risk
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today released its second Global hypertension report, showing that 1.4 billion people lived with hypertension in 2024, yet just over one in five have it under control either through medication or addressing modifiable health risks.

items.title: EU renews support for WHOâ€™s Universal Health Coverage Partnership
items.summary: WHO and the European Union (EU) have renewed their collaboration on achieving universal health coverage with the launch of Phase V (2025â€“2028) of the Universal Health Coverage (UHC) Partnership â€“ WHOâ€™s largest platform for strengthening health systems and advancing primary health care.

items.title: Amended International Health Regulations enter into force
items.summary: Today marks a milestone in global health governance as the amendments to the International Health Regulations (IHR) enter into force. This reflects a renewed global commitment to cooperation in the face of public health emergencies, shaped by hard-earned lessons of the COVID-19 pandemic.

items.title: WHO urges cost effective solutions on NCDs and mental health amidst slowing progress
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) today released a new report titled â€œSaving lives, spending lessâ€, revealing that an additional investment of just US$3 per person annually in tackling noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) could yield economic benefits of up to US$1 trillion by 2030.

items.title: Cholera kills more people for second consecutive year, while prevention and treatment available
items.summary: The global cholera statistics for 2024, shows an increase in both the number of people who fell sick and died from the disease. Reported cholera cases rose by 5% and deaths by 50% in 2024 compared to 2023, with more than 6000 people dying from a disease that is both preventable and treatable.

items.title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
items.summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

items.title: WHO updates list of essential medicines to include key cancer, diabetes treatments
items.summary: Today, the World Health Organization (WHO) has released updated editions of its Model Lists of Essential Medicines (EML) and Essential Medicines for Children (EMLc), adding new treatments for various types of cancer and for diabetes with associated comorbidities such as obesity. Medicines for cystiâ€¦

items.title: Over a billion people living with mental health conditions â€“ services require urgent scale-up
items.summary: More than 1 billion people are living with mental health disorders, according to new data released by the World Health Organization (WHO). The new findings published in two reports â€“ World mental health today and Mental Health Atlas 2024 â€“ highlight some areas of progress while exposing significantâ€¦

items.title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
items.summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

items.title: WHO, WMO issue new report and guidance to protect workers from increasing heat stress
items.summary: The WHO and WMO have released a comprehensive technical report and guidance addressing the escalating global health and economic risks posed by extreme heat, particularly in the workplace. This guidance builds on five decades of research and responds to the record-breaking temperatures of recent yeâ€¦

items.title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
items.summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

items.title: WHO designates new WHO-Listed Authorities, strengthening global access to quality-assured medical products
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has officially designated Health Canada, the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare/Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency (MHLW/PMDA) of Japan, and the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) of the United Kingdom as WHO-Listed Authoritiesâ€¦

items.title: Kenya achieves elimination of human African trypanosomiasis or sleeping sickness as a public health problem
items.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has validated Kenya as having eliminated human African trypanosomiasis (HAT) or sleeping sickness as a public health problem, making it the tenth country to reach this important milestone. HAT is the second neglected tropical disease (NTD) to be eliminated in Kenâ€¦

items.title: On World Breastfeeding Week, countries urged to invest in health systems and support breastfeeding mothers
items.summary: Strengthening health systems to support breastfeeding is not just a health imperative, it is a moral and economic imperative. WHO and UNICEF remain committed to supporting countries to build resilient health systems that leave no mother or child behind.

items.title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
items.summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.
